channel.title: Changing Summoned NPC
channel.description:
I'm going to try and explain this as best as I can...
Base: Insanity X Summoning is in the source
What im trying to achieve:
I want to make it to where when you summon the Void spinner (NPC ID 7334) (Pouch ID 12780) it instead summons my custom Jad pet (NPC ID 666). I can not find where in the world this is so i can change it...Does anyone have a clue? I've tried searching in client.java, npc, npchandler...and just about everything else, unless im just not looking for the correct thing.

item.title: Changing Summoned NPC
item.dc:creator: @divinationofgods divinationofgods
item.description:
@divinationofgods wrote:

Bowser jr:

Why is your Summoning class so horrible written?

Just how it came with the base lol

[EDIT] in ItemClick3 I found

[code] case 12780:

		summon(c, 7334);
		break;[/code]

Would i simply change 7334 to 666 and its done? or is there more to it

[EDITx2]

That was it… in almost every other sumn file it registers the monster as 7333, because 7333 and 7334 are the same bloody thing… so i changed the npc code in Itemclick3 and it now works flawlessly.

Incase anyone else has this issue later

Read full topic

item.title: Changing Summoned NPC
item.dc:creator: @divinationofgods divinationofgods
item.description:
@divinationofgods wrote:

Hyperon:

How does summoning work? If you have to click an interface button to summon the spinner then look in your ActionButtonPacketHandler class or your source equivalent. If it’s an item you have to click to summon the spinner then check your ItemOptionPacketHandler or your source equivalent etc.

that almost helped I just can’t figure out what my itemoptionpackethandler would be

Read full topic
